page.title: 11Principal features Digby.
page.content: The Church is the oldest building in Digby. It has a Norman arch at the south door dated 11OO A.D. The chancel screen is said to come from Catley Abbey. Catley Abbey was sited in Digby Fen. It was a priory with sixty nuns and monks. During the 14th and 15th centuries Digby Church was enlarged and the roof was raised and covered with slates. Formerly it was thatch. Most of the church is Early English, but the clerestory, pinnacle tower and crocketed spire are Perpendicular. The pulpit is Jacobean. There is late seventeenth century work with a fine array of bench ends. Other features include a cross and a beehive shaped well cover.
